headline: Campbell’s (CPB) Is Down 5.2% After FTSE All-World Index Removal on Rising Costs and Weak Sales
summary: On September 20, 2025, Campbell’s Company was removed from the FTSE All-World Index amid reports of rising input costs and declining unit sales. This development highlights ongoing cost pressures from tariffs and a challenging sales outlook, emphasizing the company’s need for further product improvement and operational adjustment. We’ll examine how Campbell’s rising steel and aluminum costs may reshape its investment outlook and growth plans. Explore 26 top quantum computing companies...

headline: Pepsi's chips empire is losing its shine
summary: Once PepsiCo's growth engine, Frito-Lay now faces affordability issues and shifting consumer tastes, analysts warn.
